website_summaries.verdict: A basic, bass-heavy amp that hits hard with tone but goes easy on the wallet.
pros: A stellar launching pad for new guitar players, this 15-watt amp is simple to operate and gives off full, well-rounded tones
Features clean and boost channels, along with treble, mid, and bass equalization knobs
Also includes a “phone” aux input for backing tracks
It works well for bass, too
cons: Some users have reported tinny gain sounds at high volumes

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly "LOUD" little amp !
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best small 10-20 watt electric guitar amps of all time! I use it soley for practicing. All the component knobs work fine and do what they suppose to do. I especially like to use the gain knob for added boost. The volume knob can get really LOUD for such a small practice amp! The sound is clear, clean & crisp. I really enjoy practicing with this little fat boy. And for less than fourty bucks ($39.97), it's been well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: studpuppie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than what I exspected. Running guitar, mikes, phone (music) through it without loosing any power.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Winans

customer_reviews.title: Quality starter amp held back by build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and tone adjustment for the price. Product falls short in terms of quality control, unfortunately. My third use, the 'bump' that locks the cable in broke completely so now the jack can be removed with little to no effort. Still a great starter amp.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua French

customer_reviews.title: Great Amp For The Money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little amp for the money. I use it on my bass and it really does a great job. I returned the amp because I was given the same amp from a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Worth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, a great buy, product as described, shipping on time, no complaints, thank you guys
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price. Durable, sounds decent, perfect for practicing at home or even mic it at a small event that half stacks would be overkill for.
customer_reviews.author: lan

customer_reviews.title: Eh, it’s cheap for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a week. I went in and soldered a few wires back in place. Poor construction and connections. Sometimes you get what you pay for, #cheap
customer_reviews.author: Shane Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Wow! For a small amp, it sure belts out the sound! I bought it to practice my blues harp, and it achieved what I wanted with flying colors!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Goldbogen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great item for the price! no complaints from me, but maybe from the neighbors :)
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: This amp will amaze you
customer_reviews.text: It's only 15 watts but it has gain switch and a boost button that blows most amps away. highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Michael R Dube

customer_reviews.title: Amp is junk
customer_reviews.text: didn't work from the moment it was opened. has ear blowing noise as soon as its powered on. plug in guitar, nothing. makes a little noise as if its going to do something as the plug is inserted, but right back to noise.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M. James

customer_reviews.title: Is what it is.
customer_reviews.text: It comes up a bit short when compared to entry level modeling amps, but i have no complaints. Worthing having around for 40 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: person

customer_reviews.title: amped up
customer_reviews.text: I plugged it in it works great. I need to learn how to play now.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Magee

customer_reviews.title: Good size and amprage.
customer_reviews.text: It's an amp. Seems to be fine quality. No, problems. I have two.
customer_reviews.author: Redneckoleptic

customer_reviews.title: Great amp
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great, works well, all the little knobs an function an noticeably changes the tone clarity an volume of the amp. It gets pretty loud an doesn't distort. Great buy for the price. Would buy again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Warren

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Use it with a Soundhole, and perfect. Cannot beat the price, and the sound. Must Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best $35 bucks I ever spent !
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it for anything other than a practice amp, but for the money- I'm very satisfied. Will be interesting to see if it will stand up with a drummer and a (separate) PA system.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very  cheap built
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk, save your money and buy a good amp. Worked good for about an hour total. Quit after about five combined hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Power in a small box
customer_reviews.text: It worked out well for my need. Perfect size. Good sound,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not turn on! Dont buy!
customer_reviews.text: Amp will not turn on. I got home from school and was really excited to play for my crush's birthday party, but my amp didn't turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Firveo F.

customer_reviews.title: jammin with mah bad self
customer_reviews.text: Makes clean sound in my lil studio, small and affordable! 2 for 2!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Great practice amp!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little practice amp. Well worth it’s price. Serves my purpose perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job for being so small love it
customer_reviews.author: calvin doss

customer_reviews.title: Not really much to say
customer_reviews.text: Nice sound and portable though you will need a pedal for better and different sound.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: a little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: actual amp much smaller than it appears and add.save your money spend a few bucks extra and get something quality
customer_reviews.author: Matt M.

customer_reviews.title: does not work!
customer_reviews.text: The fatboy amp arrived on time but it will not turn on. i was hoping it would "fit the bill" as the previous comment stated. alas. im left disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: patrick

customer_reviews.title: Prime shipping
customer_reviews.text: Nice little amp 2 prong plug easy to move around nice practice amp and CBG amp. It's also loud for a little amp.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Basic Practice Amp
customer_reviews.text: This is a good amp for a no-frills, basic, practice unit. It's also one of the cheaper guitar amplifiers that had mostly favorable reviews. It has a clean and a "Boost" push button. Doesn't really have distortion or overdrive. That's why I bought it, I'm going to run a wah pedal and a Blues Driver pedal through it. It works very well for that. My modeling amp doesn't work all that well for effects pedals so I picked this up cheap and have been happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: JL PopulistTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Very good little amp
customer_reviews.text: My mom bought this amp for me so I can learn to play guitar. I plugged it in and it didn’t work when I flipped the switch. So we ordered a replacement amp and the little bugger sounds great for a budget amp. It’s also better when you have an effects pedal plugged in also. But great quality for the price and even better sound.
customer_reviews.author: ICUP

customer_reviews.title: Good for practice
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for practice. It is good for practice. EDIT: also good when you want to play informally with friends who have accoustic guitars. Makes an electric fit in without dominating. Good stuff. Easy to haul around too. Show up with this and small cooler of beer and nobody blinks. :)
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hart-Davidson

product_meta.title: Fat Boy FBGA15 15 Watt Guitar Amp
product_meta.description: Color:BlackPower: 15W. Speaker 6.5". Channels: clean and boost. Controls: gain, volume, treble, middle, bass. Jacks: input, phones. Size: 270mm(W) x 152mm(D) x 305mm(H).
